result.execSummary:
The defendant ANTHONY J BUKOWSKI was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts immediately after court. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ANTHONY J BUKOWSKI

records.addlTxt: 10:13AM Defendant ANTHONY J BUKOWSKI in court.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer in court for ANTHONY J BUKOWSKI.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  No corrections or additions to the revocation packet by either party.   Victim/Witness rights complied with.  State's recommendation is in line with DOC's recommendation.  Defense argues for a lesser term of jail on Count 1.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Requesting Revocation Hearing submitted by probation agent.

10:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ANTHONY J BUKOWSKI in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Nicole A Morley in court for ANTHONY J BUKOWSKI. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.
Court amends bond to NO VIOLENT contact.  Remaining conditions:  NO VIOLENT contact with V1 in Oshkosh PD report #22-14059.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.

02:35 PM Defendant ANTHONY J BUKOWSKI in court with attorney Nicole A Morley. Prosecuting Atty Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: CONDITIONS:  No contact with V1 or V1's residence in Oshkosh PD report #22-14059.  May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.

03:07 PM Defendant ANTHONY J BUKOWSKI in court with attorney Emma K Blankschein.  Defendant ANTHONY J BUKOWSKI in custody.  Margaret Jeanne Struve appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ANTHONY J BUKOWSKI appeared by video means with Attorney.  Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties.  The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 3:11.
faxed to Sheriff's Office for handout to DE with their copy of the criminal complaint.
